original_text:
**INSTITUTION
NEUROSURGERY
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT #
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY XXX ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 25 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[Nov 30 2007]
PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS .
LUMBAR PSEUDOMENINGOCELE
SECONDARY DIAGNOSES :
1. CHRONIC PAIN SYNDROME FOLLOWED BY DR. **NAME[TTT SSS] IN WEST VIRGINIA .
2. HEPATITIS C .
3. STATUS POST LUMBAR LAMINECTOMY 2003 WITH DR. **NAME[RRR] AT **NAME[QQQ PPP] .
4. STATUS POST REVISION OF LUMBAR PSEUDOMENINGOCELE WITH DR. **NAME[OOO NNN] AT **INSTITUTION HOSPITAL , **DATE[May 2005] .
5. STATUS POST LEFT KNEE SURGERY .
6. STATUS POST BENIGN RECTAL MASS EXCISION .
PRINCIPLE PROCEDURES THIS ADMISSION :
REPAIR OF L4 DUROTOMY WITH MUSCLE , STITCH , AND DURASEAL .
REASON FOR ADMISSION :
Mr. **NAME[AAA] is a very pleasant **AGE[in 50s]- year - old Caucasian male who originally underwent a lumbar laminectomy in 2003 at an outside hospital .
He presented to our facility in **DATE[May] of 2004 with evidence of a pseudomeningocele , and at that time underwent a revision surgery with Dr. **NAME[OOO NNN] .
Unfortunately , he went on to develop symptoms again consistent with a pseudomeningocele .
This was also supported by radiographic evidence .
As a result , the decision was made to proceed with reexploration and repair of this pseudomeningocele .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
On **DATE[Nov 25]th , Mr. **NAME[AAA] was taken to the operating room where he underwent the above noted procedures which went without complication .
Postoperatively , he was placed on approximately 72 hours of flat bedrest .
Once permitted upright and out of bed , he displayed no signs or symptoms of a cerebral spinal fluid leak .
He stated that his headache symptoms were significantly improved .
He was seen and evaluated by physical and occupational therapy and deemed independent with his activities of daily living and safe for home with all further therapeutic intervention .
Thus , on postoperative day number 5 , Mr. **NAME[AAA] was afebrile with stable vitals .
He was awake , alert , and oriented , and in no acute distress .
He was tolerating p.o. intake , voiding without difficulty , and ambulating independently .
His incision line was clean , dry , and intact , with sutures in place .
At that time , he was deemed medically stable and appropriate for discharge to home .
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS :
1. No heavy lifting or strenuous activity .
2. Do not push , pull , lift , or drag anything greater than 5 pounds .
3. Avoid bending at the waist and sitting for prolonged periods of time .
4. May shower at will .
No tub bathing or soaking the incision site for the next 2 weeks .
FOLLOWUP :
1. He has been advised to contact the office of Dr. **NAME[YYY ZZZ] at **PHONE to arrange for routine postsurgical evaluation , and suture removal on Wednesday , **DATE[Dec 7 2007] .
2. He has been advised to follow up with Dr. **NAME[SSS] at the **INSTITUTION in **NAME[MMM] , West Virginia for continued pain management .
He has an appointment scheduled with them for **DATE[Jan 8 2008] , **PHONE .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. MS Contin 30 mg 1 p.o. q. 8 hours ( no prescription was provided as he is to continue to follow with Dr. **NAME[SSS] ) .
2. Oxycodone 5 mg 1 to 3 tablets p.o. q. 3 to 4 hours p.r.n. pain , dispensed #90 , 0 refills .
( I did contact the office of Dr. **NAME[SSS] to inform them that we did provide Mr. **NAME[AAA] with this prescription ) .
3. Prevacid 30 mg 1 p.o. q. day .
4. Flexeril 10 mg 1 p.o. q. 8 hours p.r.n. spasms .
5. Over - the - counter Senokot S 2 tablets p.o. at bedtime while on narcotics to avoid constipation .
___________________________________
**NAME[UUU WWW , VVV-M]
___________________________________
**NAME[YYY XXX ZZZ] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[UUU WWW , VVV-M]
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Nov 30 2007] 10:39:44
T :
**DATE[Nov 30 2007] 11:33:18
R :

Job ID :
367662 /**ID-NUM
Cc:
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[WWW , VVV-LLL] ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ]
**DATE[Dec 02 2007] 09:03:41 AM
